result.title: Seek Emergency Care
result.description: Severe breathing difficulty requires immediate medical attention.
result.reasoning: Severe shortness of breath can indicate serious respiratory or cardiac conditions that need emergency evaluation.
result.action: Go to emergency room or call emergency services immediately

result.title: See Doctor Within 24 Hours
result.description: Persistent high fever needs medical evaluation to rule out serious infections.
result.reasoning: Fever lasting 3+ days, especially if moderate to severe, may indicate bacterial infection or other conditions requiring treatment.
result.action: Schedule appointment with primary care doctor or visit urgent care

result.title: Consider Medical Consultation
result.description: Severe pain should be evaluated, especially if persistent.
result.reasoning: Pain rated 7-10/10 can significantly impact quality of life and may indicate conditions that benefit from treatment.
result.action: Contact healthcare provider for advice or appointment

result.title: Possible Respiratory Infection
result.description: Your symptoms suggest a possible cold, flu, or other respiratory infection.
result.reasoning: Combination of fever, respiratory symptoms, and fatigue are common signs of viral or bacterial respiratory infections.
result.action: Rest, stay hydrated, monitor symptoms. See doctor if worsening or no improvement in 3-5 days

result.title: Monitor for Dehydration
result.description: Vomiting and diarrhea can lead to dehydration.
result.reasoning: Loss of fluids through vomiting and diarrhea requires attention to prevent dehydration complications.
result.action: Stay hydrated with small, frequent sips of clear fluids. Seek medical care if unable to keep fluids down

result.title: Consider Medical Evaluation
result.description: Symptoms persisting 1-2+ weeks should be evaluated by a healthcare provider.
result.reasoning: Prolonged symptoms may indicate underlying conditions that could benefit from diagnosis and treatment.
result.action: Schedule appointment with primary care provider for comprehensive evaluation

result.title: Monitor Headache Symptoms
result.description: Moderate to severe headaches warrant attention, especially if persistent or worsening.
result.reasoning: While most headaches are benign, severe or persistent headaches can sometimes indicate conditions requiring treatment.
result.action: Track headache patterns, consider over-the-counter pain relief. See doctor if frequent, severe, or accompanied by other concerning symptoms

result.title: Self-Care and Monitoring
result.description: Your symptoms appear mild and recent. Focus on self-care and monitoring.
result.reasoning: Mild, recent symptoms often resolve with rest and basic self-care measures.
result.action: Rest, stay hydrated, eat nutritious foods. Monitor symptoms and seek care if they worsen or persist beyond a few days

result.title: Generally Well
result.description: You appear to be in good health with minimal concerning symptoms.
result.reasoning: Absence of significant symptoms suggests good current health status.
result.action: Continue healthy lifestyle habits. Regular check-ups with healthcare provider for preventive care

fallback.title: General Health Recommendations
fallback.description: Based on your responses, consider these general health recommendations.
fallback.reasoning: While no specific patterns were identified, maintaining good health practices is always beneficial.
fallback.action: Rest, stay hydrated, eat well, and monitor symptoms. Contact healthcare provider if symptoms worsen or new concerns arise
